page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT:LABOUR MOBILITY
page.content: In a survey of sixty-six families in Irchester we found that only 3% of the fathers worked in the village.Most fathers worked in the two nearby towns of Wellingborough (18%) and Rushden (16%).Of the others 15% were not based in any one particular place but moved around. One father travels to Milton Keynes which is 20 miles away and one to London, over 60 miles away.15% of the fathers are self employed and 9% are unemployed.We think that so many fathers work outside the village because there are not many jobs for men here. 53% of our mothers are housewives and do not have a paid job. A quarter of mothers work in the village mainly in part-time jobs and the rest work either in Wellingborough or Rushden. In a survey of Rushden shoppers 55% had a member of the family that worked outside Rushden.
